title: WWE Monday Night Raw: How to Stream Live and On Demand

steps.title: Sling Blue.
steps.content: Sling Blue. Subscribe to Sling's affordable Blue plan to watch WWE Monday Night Raw live—no cable needed. You'll also get access to A&E, where you can watch all the WWE Legends biographies, as well as 40 other channels. [1] X Research source While you won't get as many channels as other cable replacement services with Sling Blue, its affordable price makes it one of the best ways to watch Monday Night Raw without cable. Visit https://www.sling.com to learn about current promotions.

steps.title: Hulu + Live TV.
steps.content: Hulu + Live TV. While you can't watch WWE Monday Night Raw live on a regular Hulu plan, upgrading to the Hulu + Live TV plan gives you access to USA Network's live programming on any device. You'll also have access to other WWE programming like WWE Friday Night SmackDown, WWE NXT, WWE Superstars, and WWE Main Event. [2] X Research source You can get a free trial of Hulu + Live TV for 3 days to see if the service is something you want to keep. Check out https://www.hulu.com/live-tv to learn more.

steps.title: DirecTV Stream.
steps.content: DirecTV Stream. This streaming service also offers USA Network on its Entertainment, Choice, Ultimate, or Premier plans, which makes it easy to watch WWE Monday Night Raw live on any device. Despite DirecTV being known for its satellite TV service, DirecTV Stream is 100% internet-based, so all you'll need to do is download the app onto your TV, phone, or computer to start watching. DirecTV usually offers a free trial of the service. At the time of writing, you can sign up for a 5-day free trial at https://streamtv.directv.com .

steps.title: Fubo TV.
steps.content: Fubo TV. Fubo, widely known as one of the best services for live sports and local channels , is a great option for watching WWE Monday Night Raw without cable TV. You can stream live each Monday, as well as catch up on the last two seasons on demand. [3] X Research source Fubo almost always offers a free trial for their service. As long as you cancel your trial before the last day, you won't have to pay for a subscription. [4] X Research source To learn more about current offers, visit https://www.fubo.tv/welcome .

steps.title: Sportsnet.
steps.content: Sportsnet. Subscribe to Sportsnet Premium to stream WWE Monday Night Raw live. Even without cable, you can watch Sportsnet's many live sports streams using their TV or phone app or by signing in on your computer at Sportsnet.ca . Unlike a cable replacement service, you won't get a bunch of other channels with your plan, but you will be able to watch live NHL, MLB, and NBA games, all WWE Network and Live events, UFC Fight Nights, and more at a fraction of the price. [5] X Research source To learn more about Sportsnet, visit https://secure.sportsnetplus.ca/pricing .

steps.title: Hulu.
steps.content: Hulu. With a standard Hulu plan, you can watch WWE Monday Night Raw the day after it airs, plus catch back episodes from the past 12 seasons. If you don't mind waiting a day to watch Raw, Hulu is a great way to stream. See basic Hulu plan (Hulu and Hulu No Ads) details at https://signup.hulu.com/plans .

steps.title: Peacock.
steps.content: Peacock. While you can't catch the show live as it airs on Peacock, you can use the streaming service to watch 32 seasons of WWE Monday Night Raw dating back to 1993. [6] X Research source Peacock usually adds the latest episode the day after it airs, but some Reddit users have noticed it can sometimes take weeks . [7] X Research source Peacock offers two plans—one with ads, and one without. You can stream WWE Monday Night Raw on either plan. To learn more, visit https://www.peacocktv.com .

steps.title: In 2025, Netflix will be the new home of WWE Monday Night Raw.
steps.content: In 2025, Netflix will be the new home of WWE Monday Night Raw. Because the WWE Netflix deal is exclusive, Monday Night Raw and other live WWE programming will only be available on Netflix. [8] X Research source So, beginning in January 2025, you'll need a Netflix subscription to watch live on Monday nights, and you'll no longer find it on USA or other streaming services.
